words.meaning: 最后的；最终的 n. 决赛
离开；走开; 断掉; 完 prep.

words.example: My uncle is a chemist and works in a lab.

words.meaning: 运动员（通常指专业运动员）
words.example: She is a famous athlete in the Olympics.

words.meaning: 运动员（泛指，常指业余爱好者）
words.example: He is a sportsman who likes running and swimming.
The room is full of sunshine.
The boy goes to school on his scooter.

words.meaning: 接住；捉住；赶上; 患; 弄清
上学日（指需要上课的日子，与假日相对）
words.example: Monday is a schoolday, so students must go to school.

words.meaning: 路线，路径（尤指出行、旅行或交通路线）
words.example: This is the shortest route to the museum.

phrases.example: You must stop at the zebra crossing.
School starts at nine o'clock.
I come from China.
Being a teacher is my dream job.

phrases.meaning: 更喜欢 A而不是 B

phrases.example: You don't have to finish it today.

phrases.meaning: 禁止吸烟（公共标志用语）
phrases.example: No smoking in the hospital.

phrases.meaning: 禁止游泳（公共标志用语）
phrases.example: No swimming in the river.
We had a good time at the party.
sb. cannot live without air.
The north and the south have different weather.
Turn left at the corner.
Turn right after the bridge.
Turn right at the first crossing.
Turn left at the first corner.
The bank is on your left.
You will see the park on your right.
Keep walking and you will see the bank.
He often plays chess with his grandfather.
One of them is my best friend.

phrases.meaning: 去旅行（强调外出旅行这一活动）
phrases.example: They plan to go traveling during the summer holiday.

phrases.meaning: 多么可怕（用于表达强烈情感，常见于感叹）
phrases.example: How scary the movie is!

patterns.meaning: 用于形容词或副词前，表示强烈的感叹语气

grammar.title: 感叹句
grammar.definition: 用来表达强烈感情的句子，句末用感叹号。常用What和How引导。
grammar.structure: What + (a/an) + 形容词 + 名词 + 主语 + 谓语! / How + 形容词/副词 + 主语 + 谓语!
usage: What + a/an + 形容词 + 可数名词单数：What a beautiful girl she is!
What + 形容词 + 不可数名词/复数名词：What nice weather! What beautiful flowers!
How + 形容词/副词：How beautiful the girl is! How fast he runs!
判断用What还是How：看中心词是名词还是形容词/副词

mistakes.correct: What a beautiful girl she is!
mistakes.explanation: 可数名词单数前要加a/an

mistakes.correct: What a beautiful girl! / How beautiful the girl is!
mistakes.explanation: How后直接加形容词，不加冠词和名词

mistakes.correct: How nice the weather is! / What nice weather!
mistakes.explanation: What后要有名词，How后直接加形容词

examples: What an interesting story it is!

grammar.title: 常用介词
grammar.definition: 用在名词、代词或动名词前，表示时间、地点、方式、原因等关系的词。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词/代词/动名词
usage: 时间：at+时刻, on+具体日期, in+年月季节长时段
地点：at+小地点, in+大地点/里面, on+表面
方式：by+交通工具/方式, with+工具/材料, in+语言/颜色
常见搭配：be good at, be interested in, look for, wait for, listen to

mistakes.explanation: arrive in+大地点，arrive at+小地点

mistakes.wrong: I go to school by a bus.
mistakes.correct: I go to school by bus.
mistakes.explanation: by+交通工具中间不加冠词

mistakes.wrong: I'm looking forward to see you.
mistakes.correct: I'm looking forward to seeing you.
mistakes.explanation: look forward to后面接动名词

examples: The meeting will be held at 3 o'clock on Monday.
She goes to work by subway.
He is good at playing basketball.

sub_topics.title: 介词to和for的用法区别
sub_topics.definition: to强调动作结果指向，for强调受益对象
sub_topics.structure: be important to sb.; be good for sb.
usage: to表示方向或结果
for表示受益或用途
examples: This book is important to me.
Exercise is good for your health.

sub_topics.title: 介词后只能接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: to do中的to不是介词

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法（后接名词或动名词）
sub_topics.definition: pr.邀请某人做某事

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法
sub_topics.definition: without表示“没有”，后接名词或doing。
usage: 表示缺少某物或行为
examples: She passed the exam without effort.

sub_topics.title: 介词to的用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

grammar.title: 冠词
grammar.definition: 用在名词前，说明名词所指的人或事物。分为不定冠词(a/an)、定冠词(the)和零冠词。
usage: a/an用于泛指单数可数名词：a book, an apple (元音音素前用an)
the用于特指、上文提过、独一无二的事物：the sun, the book I bought
the + 形容词表示一类人：the rich (富人), the young (年轻人)
零冠词：复数名词和不可数名词泛指、球类运动、三餐、学科等

mistakes.explanation: umbrella以元音音素开头，用an
university虽以u开头，但发音是辅音/ju:/，用a
球类运动前不加冠词

examples: I saw a dog. The dog was very cute.
The moon goes around the earth.

sub_topics.title: 名词性用法判断
sub_topics.definition: 主语的含义

sub_topics.title: 过去分词作形容词
sub_topics.definition: 过去分词表示被动或完成状态
usage: 修饰名词
强调状态

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语
sub_topics.definition: to do在句中作宾语
usage: 常见于ask, want, hope等动词后

sub_topics.title: 过去分词的三种用法（完成时、被动语态、形容词）
不定式作目的状语
sub_topics.definition: 用to do表示目的
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 动词 + to do
usage: 表示“为了……”
examples: He studies hard to pass the exam.

sub_topics.title: to do与doing的区别
sub_topics.definition: to do常表示目的或将来，doing常表示已发生或习惯。
usage: 根据动词固定搭配决定

sub_topics.title: 动词原形与to do的区别
sub_topics.definition: 原形用于助动词后，to do用于不定式结构。
usage: 区分句法功能

sub_topics.title: v-ing 作主语
sub_topics.definition: 动名词短语作主语，表示一件事。
usage: 描述行为或活动

grammar.title: some和any的用法
grammar.definition: some多用于肯定句，any多用于否定句和疑问句。
usage: 数量不确定时使用

grammar.title: 第三人称单数
grammar.structure: 第三人称单数变化规则
examples: Some children have trouble with reading.

sub_topics.title: 第三人称单数变化规则
sub_topics.definition: 一般现在时中第三人称单数变化
usage: 主语是第三人称单数

sub_topics.title: 第三人称单数 + 动词s/es
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 第三人称单数的定义与用法
sub_topics.definition: 主语为第三人称单数时动词变化规则
usage: he / she / it
单数名词

sub_topics.title: 第三人称单数的判定与用法

grammar.title: 情态动词
grammar.definition: 表示说话人的语气或态度的动词，后接动词原形，没有人称和数的变化。
grammar.structure: 主语 + 情态动词 + 动词原形
usage: can/could 表能力、许可、可能：I can swim. / Could you help me?
may/might 表许可、可能：May I come in? / It may rain.
must 表必须、肯定推测：You must finish it. / He must be at home.
should 表应该、建议：You should study hard.
need 表需要（否定needn't）：You needn't worry.

mistakes.explanation: 情态动词后接动词原形，不加-s

mistakes.wrong: Must I finish it? — No, you mustn't.
mistakes.correct: Must I finish it? — No, you needn't/don't have to.
mistakes.explanation: must的否定回答用needn't或don't have to，mustn't表禁止

mistakes.wrong: He must be not at home.
mistakes.explanation: must be的否定是can't be，不是must not be

examples: You must hand in your homework on time.

grammar.title: 祈使句
grammar.definition: 用来表示请求、命令、建议、劝告等的句子，通常省略主语you。
grammar.structure: 动词原形 + 其他 / Don't + 动词原形 + 其他 / Let + 宾语 + 动词原形
usage: 肯定祈使句：Open the door, please.
否定祈使句：Don't be late. / Never give up.
Let句型：Let me help you. / Let's go.
反义疑问句：Open the door, will you? / Let's go, shall we?

mistakes.explanation: Don't后直接加动词原形，不需要to
祈使句通常省略主语you
Let's的反义疑问句用shall we

grammar.title: 代词
grammar.definition: 用来代替名词或名词短语的词，包括人称代词、物主代词、反身代词、指示代词等。
grammar.structure: 根据在句中的成分选择相应形式
usage: 人称代词主格（作主语）：I, you, he, she, it, we, they
人称代词宾格（作宾语）：me, you, him, her, it, us, them
形容词性物主代词（后接名词）：my, your, his, her, its, our, their
名词性物主代词（独立使用）：mine, yours, his, hers, its, ours, theirs
反身代词：myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves

mistakes.explanation: 作主语用主格I，且把自己放后面
独立使用时用名词性物主代词
反身代词是himself，不是hisself

examples: This is my book. That is yours.

sub_topics.title: pronoun
sub_topics.definition: 代词，用来代替名词或名词短语，避免重复，使句子更简洁

grammar.title: 不定式
grammar.definition: 由to + 动词原形构成的非谓语动词形式，可以作主语、宾语、表语、定语、状语和宾语补足语。
usage: 作宾语：I want to go home. / I decide to study hard.
作目的状语：I came here to see you.
作主语：To learn English well is important. = It is important to learn English well.
作宾语补足语：My mother asked me to clean the room.
作定语：I have something to tell you.

mistakes.explanation: want后接不定式，必须有to
make/let/have等使役动词后用省略to的不定式
感官动词see/hear/watch后用省略to的不定式或-ing

examples: She decided to become a doctor.
It's kind of you to help me.
I don't know what to do.

sub_topics.title: 不定式
sub_topics.definition: to do形式，可作多种成分
usage: 目的、宾语、主语

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语补足语
sub_topics.definition: to do形式在宾语后补充说明宾语。
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + sb. + to do sth.
usage: ask, tell, want等动词后
examples: I want you to help me.

sub_topics.title: 动词不定式作宾补
sub_topics.definition: 不定式补充说明宾语
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + 宾语 + to do
usage: 表示将要发生的动作
examples: She asked me to help her.

sub_topics.title: 不定式to do的用法
sub_topics.definition: pr.从后到前

sub_topics.title: 动词不定式作宾语补足语
sub_topics.definition: 不定式用来补充说明宾语
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + sb. + to do sth.
usage: 常见于tell/ask/invite等动词后
examples: She asked me to help her.

grammar.title: 序数词的用法
grammar.definition: 序数词用来表示顺序，如第几、次序先后。
usage: 表示顺序或排名
表示日期中的“第几天”
examples: He is the first student in the class.
April is the fourth month of the year.

grammar.title: 现在进行时
grammar.definition: 表示现在正在进行的动作，也可表示现阶段正在进行或即将发生的动作。
usage: 表示说话时正在进行的动作：He is reading a book now.
表示现阶段正在进行的动作：She is learning French this year.
表示即将发生的动作（常用go, come, leave等）：I am leaving tomorrow.
与always连用表示赞扬或不满：He is always helping others.

mistakes.explanation: be动词后面要用动词的-ing形式
know是状态动词，一般不用进行时

examples: They are watching TV at the moment.
We are having an English class now.

sub_topics.title: 现在进行时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示正在进行或现阶段正在发生的动作
usage: 表示说话时正在发生的动作
表示现阶段持续的动作
examples: She is studying English these days.

grammar.title: 特殊疑问句
grammar.definition: 用特殊疑问词（what, who, where, when, why, how等）提问的句子，不能用yes或no回答。
grammar.structure: 特殊疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序（疑问词作主语时除外）
usage: what问什么：What is your name?
who问谁：Who is that man? / Who(m) did you see?
where问地点：Where do you live?
when问时间：When did you arrive?
why问原因：Why are you late?
how问方式/程度：How do you go to school? / How old are you?

mistakes.explanation: 特殊疑问句需要助动词（疑问词作主语时除外）
who作主语时，不需要助动词did

mistakes.wrong: How many book do you have?
mistakes.correct: How many books do you have?
mistakes.explanation: how many后面要用可数名词复数

examples: What time does the movie start?

sub_topics.title: 对划线部分提问的方法
sub_topics.definition: 将划线部分换成疑问词
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句
usage: 注意时态
examples: He lives in Beijing. → Where does he live?

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句语序
sub_topics.definition: 特殊疑问句中疑问词置于句首。
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
usage: 对信息提问

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句（宾语提问）
sub_topics.definition: 对宾语提问时用what/whom等。
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
usage: 提问动作对象

sub_topics.title: wh-疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: what + 一般疑问句语序
sub_topics.definition: 使某人变得……

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句的构成
sub_topics.definition: 对句子成分提问
sub_topics.structure: 特殊疑问词 + 一般疑问句
usage: 提问时间地点原因等

sub_topics.title: wh-词 + 一般疑问句
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: what + 助动词 + 主语 + 动词原形
sub_topics.definition: 在阅读方面有困难

sub_topics.title: 特殊疑问句结构（WH-词提问）
sub_topics.definition: 使用疑问词对句子成分提问
usage: what, who, where, why 等

sub_topics.title: what + 名词 + 一般疑问句
对划线部分提问的步骤
sub_topics.definition: 将陈述句中被划线的部分转换为相应的特殊疑问句，用来询问该信息。
sub_topics.structure: 疑问词 + 一般疑问句语序
usage: 第一步：判断划线部分的含义（人、物、时间、地点、原因、方式等）
第二步：选择合适的疑问词（who, what, when, where, why, how 等）
第三步：将疑问词放在句首
第四步：剩余部分改为一般疑问句语序（有be/情态动词直接提前，没有则用do does did）
第五步：注意时态、人称和动词形式的变化
examples: He teaches people how to build houses. → What does he teach people?
They spend the summer in the mountains. → Where do they spend the summer?
Alice volunteers in summer. → When does Alice volunteer?

grammar.title: 序数词和基数词的区别
grammar.definition: 基数词表示数量多少，序数词表示顺序或次序。
grammar.structure: 基数词：one, two, three...；序数词：first, second, third...
usage: 表示数量时用基数词
表示顺序、排名、日期中的“第几”时用序数词

grammar.title: 次数表达法
grammar.definition: 用于表示动作发生的次数。
grammar.structure: 基数词 + times；once, twice, three times...
usage: 询问次数常用 how many times
once 表示一次，twice 表示两次，三次及以上用基数词 + times
examples: I have been to Beijing twice.
How many times do you exercise every week?

grammar.title: 根据文章选标题的方法
grammar.definition: 根据文章的整体内容选择能够概括全文中心思想的标题。
grammar.structure: 标题应概括全文主题，而不是只对应某一细节
usage: 优先选择覆盖全文内容的选项
避免过于具体或只涉及某一段落的标题
examples: The best title of the passage is About the Weather in China.

grammar.title: 方向与路线表达用法
grammar.definition: 用于描述行走方向和路线的常见英语表达。
grammar.structure: turn left/right; walk along; go straight; at the crossing
usage: 描述路线时通常按先后顺序说明
常与地点介词 at, on, along 搭配使用
examples: Walk along the street and turn right at the first crossing.
The post office is on your left.
